017package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure;
018
019/**
020 * Takes a linear value in the range of 0-1 and outputs a (usually) non-linear, interpolated value.
021 * The <a href="https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Interpolation">wiki docs on Interpolation</a> are extremely useful
022 * for understanding how the different implementations here behave.
023 * <br>
024 * This class is mostly copied directly from libGDX. Changes have been made to avoid copying even more over.
025 * @author Nathan Sweet
026 */
027public abstract class Interpolation {
028        /** @param a Alpha value between 0 and 1. */
029        abstract public float apply (float a);
030
031        /** @param a Alpha value between 0 and 1. */
032        public float apply (float start, float end, float a) {
033                return start + (end - start) * apply(a);
034        }
035
036        //
037
038        static public final Interpolation linear = new Interpolation() {
039                public float apply (float a) {
040                        return a;
041                }
042        };
043
044        //
045
046        /** Aka "smoothstep". */
047        static public final Interpolation smooth = new Interpolation() {
048                public float apply (float a) {
049                        return a * a * (3 - 2 * a);
050                }
051        };
052        static public final Interpolation smooth2 = new Interpolation() {
053                public float apply (float a) {
054                        a = a * a * (3 - 2 * a);
055                        return a * a * (3 - 2 * a);
056                }
057        };
058
059        /** By Ken Perlin. */
060        static public final Interpolation smoother = new Interpolation() {
061                public float apply (float a) {
062                        return a * a * a * (a * (a * 6 - 15) + 10);
063                }
064        };
065        static public final Interpolation fade = smoother;
066
067        //
068
069        static public final Pow pow2 = new Pow(2);
070        /** Slow, then fast. */
071        static public final PowIn pow2In = new PowIn(2);
072        static public final PowIn slowFast = pow2In;
073        /** Fast, then slow. */
074        static public final PowOut pow2Out = new PowOut(2);
075        static public final PowOut fastSlow = pow2Out;
076        static public final Interpolation pow2InInverse = new Interpolation() {
077                public float apply (float a) {
078                        if (a < 0.000001f) return 0;
079                        if (a >= 1f) return 1;
080                        return (float)Math.sqrt(a);
081                }
082        };
083        static public final Interpolation pow2OutInverse = new Interpolation() {
084                public float apply (float a) {
085                        if (a < 0.000001f) return 0;
086                        if (a >= 1f) return 1;
087                        return 1 - (float)Math.sqrt(-(a - 1));
088                }
089        };
090
091        static public final Pow pow3 = new Pow(3);
092        static public final PowIn pow3In = new PowIn(3);
093        static public final PowOut pow3Out = new PowOut(3);
094        static public final Interpolation pow3InInverse = new Interpolation() {
095                public float apply (float a) {
096                        return (float)Math.cbrt(a);
097                }
098        };
099        static public final Interpolation pow3OutInverse = new Interpolation() {
100                public float apply (float a) {
101                        return 1 - (float)Math.cbrt(-(a - 1));
102                }
103        };
104
105        static public final Pow pow4 = new Pow(4);
106        static public final PowIn pow4In = new PowIn(4);
107        static public final PowOut pow4Out = new PowOut(4);
108
109        static public final Pow pow5 = new Pow(5);
110        static public final PowIn pow5In = new PowIn(5);
111        static public final PowOut pow5Out = new PowOut(5);
112
113        static public final Interpolation sine = new Interpolation() {
114                public float apply (float a) {
115                        return (1 - MathTools.cos_(a * 0.5f)) * 0.5f;
116                }
117        };
118
119        static public final Interpolation sineIn = new Interpolation() {
120                public float apply (float a) {
121                        return 1 - MathTools.cos_(a * 0.25f);
122                }
123        };
124
125        static public final Interpolation sineOut = new Interpolation() {
126                public float apply (float a) {
127                        return MathTools.sin_(a * 0.25f);
128                }
129        };
130
131        static public final Exp exp10 = new Exp(2, 10);
132        static public final ExpIn exp10In = new ExpIn(2, 10);
133        static public final ExpOut exp10Out = new ExpOut(2, 10);
134
135        static public final Exp exp5 = new Exp(2, 5);
136        static public final ExpIn exp5In = new ExpIn(2, 5);
137        static public final ExpOut exp5Out = new ExpOut(2, 5);
138
139        static public final Interpolation circle = new Interpolation() {
140                public float apply (float a) {
141                        if (a <= 0.5f) {
142                                a *= 2;
143                                return (1 - (float)Math.sqrt(1 - a * a)) / 2;
144                        }
145                        a--;
146                        a *= 2;
147                        return ((float)Math.sqrt(1 - a * a) + 1) / 2;
148                }
149        };
150
151        static public final Interpolation circleIn = new Interpolation() {
152                public float apply (float a) {
153                        return 1 - (float)Math.sqrt(1 - a * a);
154                }
155        };
156
157        static public final Interpolation circleOut = new Interpolation() {
158                public float apply (float a) {
159                        a--;
160                        return (float)Math.sqrt(1 - a * a);
161                }
162        };
163
164        static public final Elastic elastic = new Elastic(2, 10, 7, 1);
165        static public final ElasticIn elasticIn = new ElasticIn(2, 10, 6, 1);
166        static public final ElasticOut elasticOut = new ElasticOut(2, 10, 7, 1);
167
168        static public final Swing swing = new Swing(1.5f);
169        static public final SwingIn swingIn = new SwingIn(2f);
170        static public final SwingOut swingOut = new SwingOut(2f);
171
172        static public final Bounce bounce = new Bounce(4);
173        static public final BounceIn bounceIn = new BounceIn(4);
174        static public final BounceOut bounceOut = new BounceOut(4);
175
176        //
177
178        static public class Pow extends Interpolation {
179                final int power;
180
181                public Pow (int power) {
182                        this.power = power;
183                }
184
185                public float apply (float a) {
186                        if (a <= 0.5f) return (float)Math.pow(a * 2, power) / 2;
187                        return (float)Math.pow((a - 1) * 2, power) / (power % 2 == 0 ? -2 : 2) + 1;
188                }
189        }
190
191        static public class PowIn extends Pow {
192                public PowIn (int power) {
193                        super(power);
194                }
195
196                public float apply (float a) {
197                        return (float)Math.pow(a, power);
198                }
199        }
200
201        static public class PowOut extends Pow {
202                public PowOut (int power) {
203                        super(power);
204                }
205
206                public float apply (float a) {
207                        return (float)Math.pow(a - 1, power) * (power % 2 == 0 ? -1 : 1) + 1;
208                }
209        }
210
211        //
212
213        static public class Exp extends Interpolation {
214                final float value, power, min, scale;
215
216                public Exp (float value, float power) {
217                        this.value = value;
218                        this.power = power;
219                        min = (float)Math.pow(value, -power);
220                        scale = 1 / (1 - min);
221                }
222
223                public float apply (float a) {
224                        if (a <= 0.5f) return ((float)Math.pow(value, power * (a * 2 - 1)) - min) * scale / 2;
225                        return (2 - ((float)Math.pow(value, -power * (a * 2 - 1)) - min) * scale) / 2;
226                }
227        };
228
229        static public class ExpIn extends Exp {
230                public ExpIn (float value, float power) {
231                        super(value, power);
232                }
233
234                public float apply (float a) {
235                        return ((float)Math.pow(value, power * (a - 1)) - min) * scale;
236                }
237        }
238
239        static public class ExpOut extends Exp {
240                public ExpOut (float value, float power) {
241                        super(value, power);
242                }
243
244                public float apply (float a) {
245                        return 1 - ((float)Math.pow(value, -power * a) - min) * scale;
246                }
247        }
248
249        //
250
251        static public class Elastic extends Interpolation {
252                final float value, power, scale, bounces;
253
254                public Elastic (float value, float power, int bounces, float scale) {
255                        this.value = value;
256                        this.power = power;
257                        this.scale = scale;
258                        this.bounces = bounces * (0.5f - (bounces & 1));
259                }
260
261                public float apply (float a) {
262                        if (a <= 0.5f) {
263                                a *= 2;
264                                return (float)Math.pow(value, power * (a - 1)) * MathTools.sin_(a * bounces) * scale / 2;
265                        }
266                        a = 1 - a;
267                        a *= 2;
268                        return 1 - (float)Math.pow(value, power * (a - 1)) * MathTools.sin_((a) * bounces) * scale / 2;
269                }
270        }
271
272        static public class ElasticIn extends Elastic {
273                public ElasticIn (float value, float power, int bounces, float scale) {
274                        super(value, power, bounces, scale);
275                }
276
277                public float apply (float a) {
278                        if (a >= 0.99) return 1;
279                        return (float)Math.pow(value, power * (a - 1)) * MathTools.sin_(a * bounces) * scale;
280                }
281        }
282
283        static public class ElasticOut extends Elastic {
284                public ElasticOut (float value, float power, int bounces, float scale) {
285                        super(value, power, bounces, scale);
286                }
287
288                public float apply (float a) {
289                        if (a == 0) return 0;
290                        a = 1 - a;
291                        return (1 - (float)Math.pow(value, power * (a - 1)) * MathTools.sin_(a * bounces) * scale);
292                }
293        }
294
295        //
296
297        static public class Bounce extends BounceOut {
298                public Bounce (float[] widths, float[] heights) {
299                        super(widths, heights);
300                }
301
302                public Bounce (int bounces) {
303                        super(bounces);
304                }
305
306                private float out (float a) {
307                        float test = a + widths[0] / 2;
308                        if (test < widths[0]) return test / (widths[0] / 2) - 1;
309                        return super.apply(a);
310                }
311
312                public float apply (float a) {
313                        if (a <= 0.5f) return (1 - out(1 - a * 2)) / 2;
314                        return out(a * 2 - 1) / 2 + 0.5f;
315                }
316        }
317
318        static public class BounceOut extends Interpolation {
319                final float[] widths, heights;
320
321                public BounceOut (float[] widths, float[] heights) {
322                        if (widths.length != heights.length)
323                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("Must be the same number of widths and heights.");
324                        this.widths = widths;
325                        this.heights = heights;
326                }
327
328                public BounceOut (int bounces) {
329                        if (bounces < 2 || bounces > 5) throw new IllegalArgumentException("bounces cannot be < 2 or > 5: " + bounces);
330                        widths = new float[bounces];
331                        heights = new float[bounces];
332                        heights[0] = 1;
333                        switch (bounces) {
334                        case 2:
335                                widths[0] = 0.6f;
336                                widths[1] = 0.4f;
337                                heights[1] = 0.33f;
338                                break;
339                        case 3:
340                                widths[0] = 0.4f;
341                                widths[1] = 0.4f;
342                                widths[2] = 0.2f;
343                                heights[1] = 0.33f;
344                                heights[2] = 0.1f;
345                                break;
346                        case 4:
347                                widths[0] = 0.34f;
348                                widths[1] = 0.34f;
349                                widths[2] = 0.2f;
350                                widths[3] = 0.15f;
351                                heights[1] = 0.26f;
352                                heights[2] = 0.11f;
353                                heights[3] = 0.03f;
354                                break;
355                        case 5:
356                                widths[0] = 0.3f;
357                                widths[1] = 0.3f;
358                                widths[2] = 0.2f;
359                                widths[3] = 0.1f;
360                                widths[4] = 0.1f;
361                                heights[1] = 0.45f;
362                                heights[2] = 0.3f;
363                                heights[3] = 0.15f;
364                                heights[4] = 0.06f;
365                                break;
366                        }
367                        widths[0] *= 2;
368                }
369
370                public float apply (float a) {
371                        if (a == 1) return 1;
372                        a += widths[0] / 2;
373                        float width = 0, height = 0;
374                        for (int i = 0, n = widths.length; i < n; i++) {
375                                width = widths[i];
376                                if (a <= width) {
377                                        height = heights[i];
378                                        break;
379                                }
380                                a -= width;
381                        }
382                        a /= width;
383                        float z = 4 / width * height * a;
384                        return 1 - (z - z * a) * width;
385                }
386        }
387
388        static public class BounceIn extends BounceOut {
389                public BounceIn (float[] widths, float[] heights) {
390                        super(widths, heights);
391                }
392
393                public BounceIn (int bounces) {
394                        super(bounces);
395                }
396
397                public float apply (float a) {
398                        return 1 - super.apply(1 - a);
399                }
400        }
401
402        //
403
404        static public class Swing extends Interpolation {
405                private final float scale;
406
407                public Swing (float scale) {
408                        this.scale = scale * 2;
409                }
410
411                public float apply (float a) {
412                        if (a <= 0.5f) {
413                                a *= 2;
414                                return a * a * ((scale + 1) * a - scale) / 2;
415                        }
416                        a--;
417                        a *= 2;
418                        return a * a * ((scale + 1) * a + scale) / 2 + 1;
419                }
420        }
421
422        static public class SwingOut extends Interpolation {
423                private final float scale;
424
425                public SwingOut (float scale) {
426                        this.scale = scale;
427                }
428
429                public float apply (float a) {
430                        a--;
431                        return a * a * ((scale + 1) * a + scale) + 1;
432                }
433        }
434
435        static public class SwingIn extends Interpolation {
436                private final float scale;
437
438                public SwingIn (float scale) {
439                        this.scale = scale;
440                }
441
442                public float apply (float a) {
443                        return a * a * ((scale + 1) * a - scale);
444                }
445        }
446}
